content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find 5 beauty salons with ratings greater than 4.8 in Seattle, WA.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/maps/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to search for "beauty salons in Seattle, WA" to begin finding salons with ratings above 4.8. The search box is most likely element [0], and the search button is [1].
Action: Type [0]; beauty salons in Seattle, WA
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
token: : Type [0]; beauty salons in Seattle, WA

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search for beauty salons in Seattle, WA was successful, but the top results have ratings of 4.7, which are below the required 4.8. I should use the filters to narrow down results to those with ratings greater than 4.8. The "Rating" filter is available at [4].
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The ratings filter panel is open. The highest available filter is "4.5" (element [6]), but we need salons with ratings greater than 4.8. I will apply the 4.5+ stars filter to maximize the chance of finding higher-rated salons as a first step, since there is no direct 4.8+ option.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results are updated, but the top salons displayed still have ratings of 4.7, which do not meet the requirement of greater than 4.8. I need to scroll down to see if there are any salons listed with a higher rating.
Action: Scroll [17]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible salons in the list still only show ratings of 4.7. To find salons with ratings greater than 4.8, I should continue scrolling down the results panel to see more salons and their ratings.
Action: Scroll [17]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.37
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results list has not changed; all salons shown still only have 4.7 stars. To find salons with ratings higher than 4.8, I need to continue scrolling down to view more listings.
Action: Scroll [17]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.39
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The salon list on the left still only displays salons with ratings of 4.7. More results might be available by either scrolling further or moving to the next page of listings. I should try clicking "Next page" to see if other salons with higher ratings are displayed there.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.42
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The new page of results still only displays salons with ratings of 4.7. None meet the requirement of being above 4.8. I should continue checking more pages by clicking "Next page" [7].
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page shows the same salons with 4.7 ratings and not higher. Clicking "Next page" again may yield more results, but the current listings are likely being repeated. However, to confirm exhaustiveness, I should click "Next page" [7] to see if higher rated salons appear on further pages.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.94
Completion: 0.48
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page seems to be stuck showing the same set of results for each "Next page" action, all with 4.7-star salons. There is no indication of listings with ratings greater than 4.8. As another approach, I should try using the "All filters" button [6] to check if there is a more granular rating filter or other way to refine the results.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.52
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "All filters" panel is open, and there is a rating filter set to "4.5". There may be an option to choose a higher rating. I should check if the dropdown at [7] allows for 4.8 or higher ratings.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The highest available rating filter is 4.5 stars; there is no 4.8 or 5.0 option. This means Google Maps does not allow filtering specifically for salons with ratings above 4.8. I should proceed with the highest setting (4.5), apply the filter, and then manually search for salons with ratings greater than 4.8 in the results.
Action: Click [13]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results are filtered by 4.5+ stars, but the ones displayed have 4.7 stars, which is not high enough. I need to scroll down to see more salons in the search results and look for those with ratings greater than 4.8.
Action: Scroll [13]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see one salon ("Beehive Salon West Seattle") with a rating of exactly 4.8, which matches the required threshold. I need to find at least 5 salons with ratings greater than 4.8, so I should keep scrolling to look for more highly rated options.
Action: Scroll [12]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have found "Lady Neptune Hair Salon, Seattle" with a 5.0 rating, in addition to "Beehive Salon West Seattle" with a 4.8 rating. These both meet the criteria. I still need to identify at least 3 more salons with ratings greater than 4.8, so I should keep scrolling through the results.
Action: Scroll [14]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Now I have found two more salons with 4.8 ratings: "Vann Studio Salon" and "Industry Salon." Adding them to the previous findings, I have identified 4 salons with ratings ≥ 4.8 (Beehive Salon West Seattle, Lady Neptune Hair Salon, Vann Studio Salon, and Industry Salon). I still need one more to complete the task, so I should keep scrolling.
Action: Scroll [14]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible new salon, "Beehive Salon," has a 4.6 rating, which does not meet the threshold. No additional salons above 4.8 are visible yet. I should continue scrolling to try to find one more salon with a rating above 4.8.
Action: Scroll [14]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.87
